Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for real-time web functionality, including expected user load, latency, and scalability needs.
Design the architecture for integrating Azure SignalR Service with the web application, including client-server communication patterns and backend integration.
Create an Azure SignalR Service instance in the Azure portal, specifying the appropriate pricing tier and region.
Set up necessary configurations for the SignalR Service instance, such as connection strings, scaling settings, and service mode (default or serverless).
Configure authentication and authorization mechanisms for SignalR connections, such as Azure Active Directory or custom token-based authentication.

Tasks.Task: Integrate SignalR Service with Web Application
Tasks.Task Description: Update the web application code to integrate with Azure SignalR Service, including client-side and server-side SDKs.
Perform testing to ensure real-time functionality works as expected, including connection stability, message delivery, and latency.
Apply security best practices, such as encrypting data in transit using HTTPS and securing access to the SignalR Service instance.
Set up monitoring and alerting for the SignalR Service instance using Azure Monitor to track connection metrics, message throughput, and errors.
Create documentation for the SignalR Service setup, including configuration details, integration steps, and troubleshooting procedures.
Conduct training sessions for the development team on using Azure SignalR Service and managing real-time web functionality.
Conduct regular audits to ensure the SignalR Service instance complies with security and performance standards.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of the Azure SignalR Service. Identify and resolve any anomalies or service disruptions.
Regularly check the connection limits and usage statistics to ensure the service is operating within expected parameters and scale as needed.
Review and update security policies, including access keys and firewall rules, to ensure the service is protected against unauthorized access.
Regularly back up the configuration settings of the Azure SignalR Service to ensure quick recovery in case of accidental changes or failures.
Conduct audits of service usage to ensure compliance with organizational policies and identify any unusual activity.
Analyze performance metrics and optimize the service configuration to improve latency and throughput for web applications.
Perform failover tests to ensure the service can recover seamlessly in case of regional outages or disruptions.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential service outages or security incidents. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Analyze billing data to identify cost-saving opportunities and ensure the service is operating within budget constraints.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Azure SignalR Service features, best practices, and security measures.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Azure SignalR Service performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
